snippet: With the Persian Gulf region still in tumult, there have been surprising signs that Tehran and Riyadh are looking to temper their destructive rivalry.
abstract: Iranian and Saudi Arabian officials have given hints of detente in the two countries' ongoing rivalry for regional dominance; Iran's current, albeit tenuous, leg up has implications in key areas where it has sparred with the Saudi kingdom and the United States; shift has emboldened Iran to seek stronger economic ties with other Persian Gulf States.

byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink contributed reporting from Tehran.

lead_paragraph: With the Persian Gulf region still in tumult, there have been surprising signs that Tehran and Riyadh are looking to temper their destructive rivalry.

headline.main: Saudi Arabia and Iran Reach Out Tentatively
headline.print_headline: Saudi Arabia and Iran Reach Out Tentatively
